original_title: National Chamber to host B2B meetings with 10-member business delegation from India
original_body_lines: The National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka in association with the IGTD Exim Chamber of Commerce in India, will conduct a B2B session for the Sri Lankan corporate/business community to explore trade and investment opportunities between the two countries on Tuesday, 9 January at 3 p.m.at the National Chamber Auditorium.

The business delegation would comprise of importers of several products such as, cinnamon, clove, coconut, tea, rubber, granite, marbles as well as exporters of corn, garlic, millet, mustard cake, mustard oil, onion and onion powder, frozen French fries, potato, red chilli, green chilli, other agri products and filter products such as air oil separators, basket filters, ceiling filters, cyclone separators.
Profiles of the delegates can be obtained from the National Chamber by contacting Nishanthi or Thushari (011 4741788/2689600/076 2555707) or sending a request to [email protected]; [email protected].

NCCSL invites the business community to maximise this opportunity to enhance their business operations. The allocation of B2B appointments will be on first-come-first-served basis due to limited number of meetings that could be accommodated.
